page.title: 11E.O.D.T.I.C.
page.content: back to the mid 19th century. Much of the work of the centre lies in the identification and where necessary advice on the render safe procedure of items of explosive ordnance recovered by Nato bomb disposal teams. A vital roll of the Custodian is to be available to answer questions directly from bomb disposal teams who are actually working on bombs they cannot identify themselves. He must be able to provide them with the necessary imformation as quickly as possible from the description they give to him. At present the centre is working on computerising the library's catalogue of imformation so as to speed up the search procedure. During last year EODTIC identified 348 items of ordnance and responded to 545 requests for imformation.
